Author: blackjok3r#3181
blackjok3r#3181
Content: I guess I will merge upstream down, and make sure I can build everything in the new branch with those changes. Then we need new chains with this new data. ONce 2we have some data I can work out how to extract it and add to the new RPC.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: We can also add one of these new chains james is working on, as a seperate chain, so we can test his new changes, to make sure they dont break anything.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: This will be needed before launch.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: So I have 3 new chains for testing - Stress Test Logging, Dragonhound spam test, jl777 Test chain.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Does that sound right?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: We needto check with james on specifics of his new chain and what he needs tested.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: As we now need to merge the code down, we need to test it...

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Ok, and need to find out if PoS can be on-demand.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I think that it can, as long as there is no block reward.... Keep in mind an on demand chain cannot be in the cluster

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: without blocks happening, the MoMoM hash cannot get built.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Ahh, maybe better to put that on-demand off then.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: it wont take up that much extra, but having too many chains, will make this test a little hard... we should keep scale in mind but not go overboard.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: It will get expensive fast if we have too many chains.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: With a Dragonhound chain and log chain both doing a lot of oracle transactions while the migration stress test is going on will it be a bit of a simulation for the Scaling Test?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes this is the idea... I was asked to incorperate othe new types of txs into that...

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Is it better to do a pure migration test first?  Then add oracle action when that's complete?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Hard to say... at this point we just need new chains so we can test something, as right now the whole CFEK network is not really usuable for migrates.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: So next step is making new chains to test RPC?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes, I need to get this stuff working, it should be the last of any hardforking changes needed..

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: unles we find more

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ondemand is independent of consensus mechanism

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: migrates depend on block to be happening though, so on demand is not compatible with a cluster,

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: it would probably work, but you need to tx generate to keep the chain moving

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: makes sense. ondemand is just the miners waiting for a mempool tx

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Should we add a 100%PoW or 2 also?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: not sure... those are easier for test chains as we dont need to worry about staking... that said, if someone wants to ruin th test they can stall the chains... so

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: I was thinking just for these tests, more to simulate Scaling, not for final launch config.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I think it should be ok to just do something easier yes.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: What we want at first is simply 2 chains in a cluster

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Once everything on those is confirmed to at least work, we can launch everything else... We cna keep CFEK and CFEKLF if ppl need those for existing work.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: these changes are in a new branch at least for now...

Author: CrisF#3405
Content:
So something like this?
Test jl777 chain
100%POW -- Dragonhound cluster  (fresh chains, just testing migrations)
add Log chain (outside observer, not in cluster, see how oracle activity effects migrations, start logging)
add new 100%POW -- new Dragonhound to CFEK -- CFEKLF cluster with Log chain (logging, outside observer)
Go sick, logging mass migrations.
